title: Welcome to this class!
text:
This website will walk you through the tutorials for the Topics in Economics (1S002) course of Ecole Polytechnique’s Bachelor program.
The course has 3 main objectives:

title: Welcome to this class!
text:
Class outline

Tutorial 1 (11/02 - computer session)

Presentation of the class objectives
First hands on R
First hands on LaTeX

Tutorial 2 (18/02)

Baseline Solow model derivations
Solow model extensions

Tutorial 3 (25/02 - computer session)

Replication of Mankiw et al. (1997)
First hands on the OLS estimator
Estimating the baseline and augmented Solow models

Tutorial 4 (11/03 - computer session)

OLS bias and Instrumental Variables
Replication of Acemoglu et al. (2010)
Export the results

Tutorial 5 (18/03)

Discussion on the group project
Q&A

Tutorial 6 (01/04 - computer session)

Autonomous replication of an IV paper (handed in)

Tutorial 7 (08/04 - computer session)

Treatment effect
Solution of Tutorial 6

Tutorial 8 (15/04)

Refresher on utility maximization program
Intertemporal maximization problem

Tutorial 9 (22/04 - computer session)

Work-leisure trade-off
Women labour force participation

Tutorial 10 (06/05 - computer session)

How to write the research project

Tutorial 11 (13/05 - computer session)

Difference-in-differences estimation
Marriage output matrices
Measures of assortative mating

Tutorial 12 (20/05)

Mock exam correction

Tutorial 13 (27/05)

Research project
Final Q&A

Tutorial 14 (TBD)

Restitution of the group projects (graded)

title: Welcome to this class!
text:
About this site
This site is for teaching purpose. The majority of its material was built by Matéo Moglia, who taught this class in previous years. It is inspired by the following sources:

Florian Oswald teaching material at Sciences Po
R Tutorials of the French Ministry of Ecology (in French)
The infamous online book Econometrics with R
